author: ralexstokes
content: am i correct to assume that a node is not syncing if it has a `sync_distance` of `0` according to this API endpoint: https://ethereum.github.io/eth2.0-APIs/#/Node/getSyncingStatus ?

author: ralexstokes
content: lighthouse returns an explicit `is_syncing` flag, seems like teku does not but i'm guessing the previous stmt holds

author: ajsutton
content: I like having an explicit flag but it wasn't in the spec.  Would quite happily add it to Teku if there was agreement.  I really dislike having to infer it from sync_distance.  Teku does explicitly set sync distance to 0 if we're not syncing regardless of how far behind the current slot our best block is.

author: ajsutton
content: ie sync_distance will be 0 even if the current slot was empty.

author: ralexstokes
content: makes sense, i'll just use  "syncing? : sync_distance != 0" for now

author: ralexstokes
content: although lighthouse may use sync_distance of 1 while they transition to the next block....

author: ralexstokes
content: i'd +1 a reliable way to know if a node is "syncing" or not
